description.narrative: The overall objective of the Second Phase of the Basic Education Project is to continue supporting the Government of Uzbekistan's (GoU) efforts to improve the effectiveness of teaching and learning through: 1) targeted interventions in selected general secondary education schools and preschools in poor, rural areas; 2) development of institutional capacity to assess student learning; and 3) adoption of predictable and transparent school budgets in selected oblasts. This restructuring paper seeks management approval: to a request from the GoU dated October 9, 2012 to restructure the Second Basic Education Project (BEP 2) i.e. to use project savings of US $ 9.53 million to expand activities under component one; and to adjust the project's results framework to better align it with project-financed activities especially since the project will no longer finance the follow-on student assessment for grade eight and will finance the evaluation of per-capita financing in schools across the entire country.

title.narrative: Percent of teachers at sampled project schools and preschools who are changing their teaching practice towards a more student centered approach

comment.narrative: 0% is the assumed baseline due to lack of data; this will be changed when and if accurate data will be available.
Classroom observation of teaching practices is being completed.

title.narrative: National standardized assessments of student learning carried out periodically in grade 4 with report analyzing and disseminating the results.

baseline.value: First national assessments carried out for grades 4 and 8 under phase one of APL.

comment.narrative: The first student assessment of Grade 4 and Grade 8 were carried out in 2009 under BEP 1. This indicator refers to carrying out ansecond round of assessment for grade 4 under BEP 2.

target.value: Report on results for grade 4 assessments prepared and disseminated.

comment.narrative: This indicator was changed during the restructuring of the project in 2012 (to exclude grade 8 assessment)

actual.value: Report on results for the periodically done grade 4 assessments was prepared and disseminated on March 27, 2014.

comment.narrative: This indicator was changed during the restructuring of the project in December 2012 (to exclude grade 8 assessment)

title.narrative: An increase in learning outcomes in Grade 4 that is greater in project schools than in non-project schools as measured by a new standardized test of learning achievement available for a sample of stud

comment.narrative: This is the first time that results from the baseline (from the first round of grade 4 student assessments carried out under BEP1)have been noted here, following the analysis of the data by the MOPE consultant.

target.value: Project schools scores improve and move closer those of non project schools.

comment.narrative: Following the provision of the baseline data, the team has defined the end target for the project.

title.narrative: Percent of schools boards at project schools that have implemented a school improvement proposal

comment.narrative: 500 out of 1,501 project schools have implemented small grants.

title.narrative: Percent of project schools that have received the requested learning materials

comment.narrative: All 1,501of beneficiary schools received learning materials By September 2013. An additional 694 schools have received equipmentinFebruary 2014.

title.narrative: Percent of teachers at sampled project schools where learning materials acquired under the project are used effectively in classrooms .

comment.narrative: Over 90% of teachers in schools that received learning materials under the project, used them effectively. Details are givenbelow:Basic school teachers: 99% of teachers those who went to training used the learning material effectively vs. 87.3 % of thosewho didn't attend training. Pre-school teachers: 97.5% of teachers who attended training associated with the learning materialsused thelearning material effectively . 94.1 % of teachers who didn't attend the training also used the learning materialeffectively.Classroom observation has been completed. Report will be disseminated on March 27, 2014.

title.narrative: Number of teachers at preschools and schools trained

comment.narrative: The result of all three rounds of training (direct and indirect) has led to the target being exceeded.

title.narrative: Percent of schools participating in per capita finance that are getting more than 10 percent above or below average spending per student
Report prepared and disseminated comparing results in baseline survey of schools and households with results from follow up survey

baseline.value: Baseline survey carried out in phase 1 of APL

target.value: Follow up to baseline survey carried out. Report prepared and disseminated.

comment.narrative: The follow up to baseline survey is partially covered under three surveys (classroom teaching observation, Student assessment, andschool grants), but these are not comparable to the baseline survey.

title.narrative: Per capita financing implemented with report analyzing and disseminating the results.

baseline.value: Begin implementation in three new oblasts and refine implementation in three original oblasts.

target.value: Report on national implementation of PCF is prepared and disseminated.

comment.narrative: This indicator was changed during the restructuring of the project in 2012.

actual.value: PCF implemented all over the country. Report prepared and shared with the Bank. Results from the reports were disseminated onMarch 27, 2014.

comment.narrative: It is noted that the client didn't use Bank financing for this activity. They designed and rolled out the PCF to entire country.

title.narrative: Learning assessment results for 4th and 8th graders from national assessments

target.value: Second round of grade 4 assessment carried out. Results analyzed and disseminated

comment.narrative: The indicator was changed at the project restructuring ( to exclude grade 8 assessment)

actual.value: Second round of G4 assessment was conducted in May, 2013.

comment.narrative: The report is being finalized and is expected to be shared with the Bank by end December, 2013.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: The Minister of Education has confirmed at the closing conference on March 27, 2014 that SBTT has been adopted as a formaltrainingstrategy for addition to the formal teacher training program.

actual.value: The evaluation is a compilation of the results of three surveys: (i) student assessments (ii) classroom teaching observation; and(iii) school grants implementation. The results were disseminated on the project closing conference on March 27, 2014.
